name: Dagmar
title: Dubious Casino
text: I won 5K (without bonus). Verification took several days. Casino accepts deposits via Visa, Master, Bitcoin and Tether.Terms and conditions state that withdrawal should be via deposit method.I deposited with Visa and Master - when I tried to withdraw, only Master and Bitcoin were available - both at a limit of 400 EUR per day (and not at 2000 EUR per day as stated in their terms and conditions).Visa-withdrawal wasn´t available, so I tried to withdraw via Mastercard (according to terms and conditions) - I waited 2 days until withdrawal changed form "pending" to "approved". At the 3rd day I had the message "the request was canceled for technical reasons. Try to create the request again". The first time I really thought, it was just a glitch - and I tried to withdraw 400 again ... and again ... all attempts were rejected, all showed the message above.I contacted casino via chat - they told me that there are technical issues paying to the Mastercard - and I should use Bitcoin.I don´t have Bitcoin, I don´t have a clue about Bitcoin, I don´t have time to learn about Bitcoin. If I wanted to use Bitcoin, I would have used a Bitcoin-casino.Also, casino has a DMCAprotected Icon on the site - but DMCA has not protected nor scanned the site.If I receive my money from this casino I will amend this review accordingly.

name: Sohail Ezaz
title: Suspended Account Without Reason After Large Deposit – Extremely Disappointed!
text: I have been a loyal AstroPay user for over 5 years, but my recent experience has been extremely frustrating and unacceptable. I deposited INR 1,50,000 into my AstroPay wallet, and immediately after, my account was suddenly suspended without any clear explanation. They vaguely mentioned "discrepancies" but refused to share any specific details.Despite multiple emails requesting clarification, all I received were generic responses stating that my account is under review for 30 days. Holding a customer's hard-earned money without proper justification is highly unethical and raises serious trust issues.I urgently needed access to my funds, but AstroPay has shown no willingness to expedite the process or even explain what's happening. I strongly advise others to be cautious with this platform — your money is not safe, and their customer support is slow, unhelpful, and lacks transparency.Until now, my issue remains unresolved, and I am considering legal action if this is not addressed immediately.

text: Unfair Account Restriction with No Transparency.I’m very disappointed with my experience using AstroPay. My account was permanently blocked without any clear reason or explanation. I was willing to cooperate fully if there were any misunderstandings, but the support team refused to review the case further or provide details.AstroPay may work well for some, but in my experience, their customer support lacks fairness and transparency, especially when users are left in the dark with no chance to appeal or correct a situation.I hope they reconsider how they handle such cases moving forward.

name: Kumar Shubham
title: Rs 2600 Not Credited to AstroPay Account Despite Successful UPI Payment (UTR 513587619532).
text: Update: Though AstroPay customer care kept saying that the payment had failed and the amount would be refunded by my bank, my bank clearly informed me that the transaction was successful, and the money was successfully remitted to the merchant. On 27th May, Rs. 2600 was finally added to my AstroPay wallet. Honestly, AstroPay should have at least acknowledged that the payment was successful.User ID - QaYPxV9AI am extremely disappointed with the way my issue is being handled.Made a deposit using UPI of Rs 2600 on May 15, 2025, 8:36 PM, Payment ID 439817342.Payment Method: Google Pay (UPI)Merchant Name: BLISSCART BAZARUPI ID: blisscart@idfcbankTransaction Number (UTR) : 513587619532Issue: Amount not credited to AstroPay account.The payment was successfully processed and the amount was debited from my bank account. However, the funds have not been added in my AstroPay wallet.After waiting for some time, I contacted AstroPay Support and shared the payment screenshot. I was advised to wait for 24 hours, after which appropriate assistance would be provided if the issue remained unresolved.Following the advice, I contacted support again the next day (after more than 24 hours), shared all relevant screenshots again, and also uploaded the required details on the website. Despite these steps, i received no help.I have contacted your support team multiple times and shared all relevant screenshots. However, instead of resolving the issue, I was told that the transaction failed in their system and that I would receive a refund. This is completely misleading as my bank is saying that Payment was successful and I will not get refund, I need to contact the merchant for refund.The Merchant has received the money and is not crediting it to my AstroPay account. This raises serious concerns about the integrity of operations of Astropay, and from my point of view, this is starting to look like a scam.kindly provide me refund or add the amount in my astropay wallet.20-05-2025 - No Update yet no refund, Customer care is saying that the transaction was failed on their side, Bank is saying money is with the merchant and transaction was successful. Astropay told me to wait till 26th May 2025. Let's see.

name: isaac adarkwa
title: Astropay Is Scam
text: Recently, I made a review of my ordeal with the Astropay payment transfer for which their support team immediately responded to help resolve my issue as quickly as possible. I captioned my review 'Astropay scam'. After my Trustpilot review I have had three interactions with Astropay through emails. I can now verify my experience with this company with evidence. I can now substantiate my statement of scam with enough inconsistency and irregularities in Astropay's dealings with me. The genesis of my experience is that I made a withdrawal of $300 from my Deriv Account 20646119 with Ticket 2024763356 on 27th August 2024 to Astropay. This was my first time. I tried severely to withdraw this money from the Astropay platform to my registered MTN mobile money number many times but failed. I used my registered Telecel that also failed. I tried withdrawing with another Deriv trader's number (who is my biological brother) for this same withdrawal attempt and also failed. From August to December was sole frustration and pains to take my money. I could log in to see my wallet with $304 with Astropay but their system would not open to get me verified. I did verify my identity with different email on 26th December, 2024 and to my shock immediately after the verification the $304 in my account now was $0.0. I made a complain but no response. It is only after making a review on Trustpilot that Astropay sent me emails. Now Astropay saying I made a transfer of $300 from my wallet to the Deriv trader (my brother) on 28th August, that I used his number and that I have violated the company's rule. They want me to reconcile my phone number for the 'transaction' with my brother's number. Now, I just read their claims and wonder what some traders who do not complain go through. Just yesterday I received another message from Astropay saying that my $300 is in my brother's wallet so I should inform him to verify his identity with them so that he can access this money and also they will not communicate with me again on this. Just look at this. From my wallet to my brother's wallet?. My questions to Astropay are these; 1. If I could not withdraw my money before my verification on their system, how could I transfer this same money from the same platform to another person?. 2. if there was any transaction on my account, why would Astropay not send me notification to know the state of my account on the said 28th August transaction? 3. According to the Astropay's letter yesterday, I am to inform my brother to contact them for verification so that he can take the money. What type of business deal is this. Who sent that $300 to Astropay? 4. Why could they not inform me about the state of my account if there was any transaction?5. Has the Astropay team sat down to check the irregularity and the inconsistency in their messages. My brother has written to Astropay yesterday and community of traders are watching to see the outcome. I leave this to the readers to draw their own conclusion.

name: Cristian
title: They responded to the problem but...
text: They solved the problem. Thanks to this medium, they contacted me and almost immediately I had the account enabled again. I have to be honest and say, like I said the bad experience, this was excellent and I am very grateful because the product really interests me and seems good to me. Thanks to the Astropay support people who solved the problem and thanks to Trustpilot because without this I would still be fighting against chatGPTs that respond automatically.Best regards. Cristian.------------------------------------------------------------They just sent me this email: "Hello Cristian,Thank you for your patience so far.We received your Trustpilot review and have taken steps to resolve the issue for you.Your account with phone number +5411******08 has been enabled and is now fully functional.We apologize for any inconvenience you have experienced with this issue.Please feel free to contact us if you have any further questions or concerns.Sincerely,Fiona BrownCustomer SupportOperation Teamwww . astropay . com"I was able to log into the account again, it is true, but to use the card again it asked me to contact support and that is what I did. Guess what happened:Yeah! They blocked the account again saying the same speech about security that they "take very seriously"It really is unusual! I think they have no support, they are a ChatGPT always repeating the same thing in a loop.ORIGINAL REVIEW:-----------------------I am really disappointed with …I am really disappointed with the account/application. I was on vacation in Europe, specifically in Paris, when I was trying to transfer funds to use the card and, for no apparent reason, they blocked my account and told me that they would not re-enable it for "security" reasons.I made several claims to be informed of the reason for the blockage and to indicate the violation; but they do not do so, they always repeat the same answer and do not give a solution. The worst of all is that they tell me to fill out some data so that they can send the case for analysis and they LITERALLY respond to me 5 after minutes saying "then an exhaustive analysis, we have made the decision to permanently block your account..." and so on with each of the complaints I made. It gives the impression that they do not evaluate anything!I honestly do not know what else to do. I am very interested in having this product, but unfortunately they do not give me a solution. It is unusual because I have accounts in several types of similar applications and capital market brokers and the only one I had problems with was them.

I DON'T UNDERSTAND! I don't even have a balance on this app because I've never logged into that platform, anyway, I don't even know how the site works (?). I think it's a mistake to force someone to validate their account when they're told they'll be charged a fee if they don't, when I've never accessed their platform. Again, at the time I had no intention of rushing to validate my data, maybe I would do it later. But, what happened to me seems like a bad attitude on the part of the site...

Despite writing multiple emails they seem very reluctant to provide any updates on emails. As of 10/01, the case is open will no responses.

text: Astropay is dump and they'll frustrate you. If you read this, never open an account with them even if you've an account with them go back and close it now. I withdrew money on Deriv and it was supposed to be paid into my mobile money wallet on August 1, 2024 but I never received the money. So it was on August 13, 2024 that I realized Astropay is secretly keeping the money on their system without even informing me. I was blaming Deriv for not sending my money not know Deriv sent it the same day but Astropay secretly kept the money. I tried withdrawing my money from Astropay but they requested that I exchange from dollars to Ghana cedis. I couldn't exchange because they said I don't meet the minimum balance for exchange so I had to deposit more dollars again into Astropay to exchange and withdraw to Ghana cedis. As I'm typing this now, they've restricted my account with the excuse that it's under review. I've done verification and when I contacted them they're saying it will take 30 days to access my funds. I wish I could share a screenshot of the emails from Astropay. As deposit they'll ask you to do more but for you to get your money back will be a challenge. Refrain from Astropay, close your account if you've one. Forget the positive reviews here because many of them might have been paid to do that. I feel Africans are the most vulnerable to Astropay. My fellow Africans, let's use our own payment system where we won't be cheated. Thank you.

title: My experience with AstroPay is awesome
text: My experience with AstroPay is awesome! From the moment I started using it, I found the platform to be incredibly user-friendly and efficient. Deposits onto my AstroPay account are quick and hassle-free, and making payments to merchants works like a charm! I never have to worry about delays or complications, which makes my online shopping and transactions seamless.One of the standout features of AstroPay is the card cashback. The cashback rewards are genuinely good and add significant value to my purchases. It feels great to get rewarded for spending, and this feature definitely sets AstroPay apart from other payment solutions.Overall, I highly recommend AstroPay for anyone looking for a reliable, secure, and rewarding payment option.

Then you raise a ticket or use live chat to complain, and wait and wait and wait and gets resolved after 1-2 days maybeUgly: Customer support of AstroPay is atrocious!!!! It takes ages to get a reply on any questions you ask irrespective of chat or mail or the forms!!!! This seriously pisses me off as such a financial platform is supposed to have a fast and reliable customer support team. You have got the worst support team ever in terms of timely responses and answering to the precise questions!!! Unbelievably slowCherry on top: I have used the live chat several times, couple of times waited for 12 straight hours for a reply. Finally you sleep and suddenly someone comes on chat says something, then say that since there is no activity for 30 minutes we are closing the chat! What about the 12 hours which I spend waiting for you? I can’t sit without food and sleep for 24 hours for a response from youUpdate: Review details added as per below requestNew Update 18 July: Raised a ticket on 12 July, last communication from AstroPay on 15July. name: Dan
title: Hacked account, insecure platform
text: Signed up to Astropay as a result of their cashback deal offering 20% cashback on any food and drink purchases at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.Worked fine on my first visit, however within a month my account was hacked and all funds withdrawn.I raised a complaint about this on the 1st May, and initially Astropay denied any responsibility and send me "advice" on a stronger password and only to reply to emails with "astropay.com" as the sender (all of which I had already done).After going back and forth with Astropay support fobbing me off, I looked into what action I could take. I ended up emailing them with a threat to report them to both the Financial Conduct Authority and the Financial Ombudsman, per their guidelines. This spurred them into action, they replied the same day informing me that most (not all) of the funds had been refunded. They refunded the remaining amount when I questioned this.In a nutshell:- Astropay is susceptible to hacking.- They will try to fob you off with excuses unless you threaten legal action.I would avoid them in future and am amazed that a company/brand like Tottenham Hotspur would associate with them.

title: Astropay is nothing but a scam
text: Astropay is nothing but a scam! I warn future customers to this service to not sign up for it. I transferred roughly 150 euros to my virtual card, later when i wanted to use my money my purchases kept being declined, i tried different services, and it was all the same. So i reached out to customer support which wasnt the most easy thing to do, i later to my big surprise got an answer from support and they wanted me to provide some screenshots on the purchases i tried to make, so i did. Later they replied that the merchant i was trying to buy from wasn't supported, Although i know that it is because its listed on their website as possible payment methods. So i told them i had tried different merchants and that it was the same. After that i did not get an answer from them. Told them i wanted my money back since i couldn't spend them, still no response. So beware of these fraudsters! Spread the word!

name: Alen Rayen
title: Disappointed with Astropay's Poor Customer Service and Unresolved Transaction
text: Review:I am extremely disappointed with the service provided by Astropay. Over ten days ago, I encountered a concerning issue with a pending transaction on my Astropay account. Despite my attempts to resolve the matter by reaching out to Astropay's customer support team, I have received no response or resolution.On February 7th, 2024, I initiated a transaction of Rs. 1,392 to add funds to my Astropay account using the UPI payment method. While my SBI Bank Account was successfully debited with the amount, the funds have yet to be credited to my Astropay account. The transaction status remains "In review" without any progress or explanation from Astropay.I have made multiple attempts to communicate with Astropay's customer support team, including sending detailed emails and providing necessary documentation such as transaction details from both the Astropay app and my SBI Bank Account Statement. Despite my efforts, Astropay has failed to acknowledge my complaint or provide any updates on the status of the pending transaction.This lack of response and failure to resolve the issue within a reasonable timeframe is unacceptable. As a customer, I expect timely and efficient service, especially when dealing with financial transactions. Astropay's disregard for customer concerns reflects poorly on their professionalism and commitment to customer satisfaction.I urge Astropay to prioritize resolving pending transactions and improving their customer support system to ensure timely responses and resolutions for all customers. Until Astropay addresses these issues and demonstrates a commitment to better customer service, I cannot recommend their services to others.Conclusion: Astropay's failure to address my concerns and resolve the pending transaction has left me deeply dissatisfied with their service. I hope this review serves as a warning to others considering using Astropay's services.Name: Alen RayenContact: 9944946866

name: Tim B
title: Might be wise to steer clear for the time being.
text: I had the same experience as Glenn, below.There's no way to get hold of any customer service to resolve issues.I emailed their support address (as that's what their website tells you to do) but then got an automated reply telling me to fill in a form online instead... The social media links at the bottom of their email (e.g Facebook and X) just go to the main page for that site (which is odd as that is standard scam email behaviour).My initial impressions are not great (particularly for a company expecting me to trust them with my money)!I note that "This company’s TrustScore is currently unavailable due to a breach of Trustpilot’s Guidelines." Looks like they'd be buying fake reviews try to prop up their score. Dodgy!Seems like they are having some issues. Might be wise to steer clear for the time being.UPDATE: After I posted the review they asked me for my customer details which I provided, but a day later (20th Jan) they have yet to respond to that or the original issue (despite saying below "once we receive the necessary information, we will take immediate action to address your concerns").In the meantime I've withdrawn the money I had deposited with them in case that becomes impossible in the near future. Don't want to risk it!2nd UPDATE: They did eventually resolve the issue (so thank you for that). But it took two weeks. I think when it's a financial institution (and not a very well know one, at least in the UK) and the issue relates to missing money, that customer services should respond more promptly than that (and also not provide conflicting information on their website and automated email in the meantime).

name: Daniel Calantes
title: CANADIANS BEWARE
text: Unless you want to be able to get your money out, STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY (at least here in Canada).They should've had an easy to access memo about this issue in the first place.An email response was sent to me as follows when I contacted their support:"Our operations team is working hard on getting them reinstated. We appreciate your patience.However, if you are in need of the money urgently, we advise you to use it for a merchant deposit so you can have an alternative withdrawal method from the other platform."I would've been able to appreciate it if they only provided workable alternative options to take my money out in the meantime, like a link to a website or something.I'm not a gambler and I understand that a lot of people who uses Astropay are those who gamble.However, for a regular individual like me with my only need is being able to have a platform where I can easily put in money and out with low fees, this is a MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT.And all they can offer me is this? Tell you what. When I fed you guys my money, it was through eTransfer. Why can't the same solution be offered when taking money out? How hard can it be for your Operations team to make that happen?This review is not going out until I get my money back.May this serve as a harbinger to those thinking about using this service in Canada. Again, when your money goes in, there's no way back. You've been warned.

During this time I also asked for physical card / this did arrive on time but the card number was different to the card number on the app and was unable to verify this. - this wasn’t resolved so in the end I gave up and requested my account to be cancelled - hoping my experience is isolated - but am left with a very poor opinion on AstroPay.

They are fraudulent, they will keep your money and will tell you they have system issues. I strongly advise that you use any other wallet other than Astropay. name: JD
title: Unresolved Deposit Issue and Lack of Customer Support: Astropay's Prolonged Delay of 2 MONTHS and Inadequate Response
text: I am writing to reiterate my deep dissatisfaction with Astropay's services, particularly regarding a deposit issue that has persisted for nearly two months. Unfortunately, despite my numerous attempts to address the matter through their customer care, I have experienced a lack of effective resolution.My initial deposit of INR 2000 on September 6th, 2023, using one of Astropay's available deposit options, has yet to be credited to my Astropay account. This prolonged delay has not only caused significant inconvenience but has also left me questioning the reliability of Astropay's services.Despite my efforts to seek assistance, I have consistently received robotic and standard responses from their customer care team, providing no clarity on when the issue will be resolved. The lack of transparency and the continuous runaround I am experiencing are not only frustrating but also reflect poorly on the company's commitment to customer satisfaction.To date, Astropay has failed to provide any concrete resolution to this case, and their constant requests to wait for ongoing investigations have become increasingly frustrating. Waiting for two months without a clear timeline for resolution is unacceptable, and I find it concerning that such a significant delay persists without a satisfactory explanation.I strongly advise potential users to exercise caution and reconsider engaging with Astropay. The lack of timely resolution and the apparent lack of urgency in addressing customer concerns raise serious questions about the company's reliability and customer service standards. My experience has been deeply disappointing, and I believe others should be aware of the challenges I have faced with Astropay's services.Date of experience: September 06, 2023Update as of 20/11/23: No resolution offered so far. While I acknowledge your assurance that the Support Team is actively working on the matter, I must express my disappointment with the nature of the response. It appears to follow a template that is generic and transactional, lacking the specificity and personalized attention that a two-month-long, unresolved issue deserves.I remain deeply dissatisfied with the lack of transparency and the way this issue is handled.

text: Major scammers same with @PayBis, I had been buying crypto from PayBis little did I know they were using AstroPay as their services I had a full on account on PayBis I went to sell my crypto on PayBis, it generates a wallet address for me to send the funds too, I send them and am told I will get a etransfer in 10 minutes. That goes by so I reach out to them, I am told I need contact AstroPay. That’s when AstroPay informs me I don’t even have an account with them. Trying to register an account to get access to my funds but it won’t let me verify my number and now I have not a single response from either companies and have been left scammed please don’t use any of their services I will be reporting them

name: Lucas R
title: Used to be amazing, sad to see whats happening
text: 2 months ago they would have gotten five stars, now however…I have used AstroPay since may/june 2023. The first few months was AMAZING, but ever since I had to delete my account and make a new one because of new phone number, it’s been nothing but a headache. I contacted Astro on numerous occasions, asking to proceed with the termination of the account. Vague responses/no actions made me think it was all good for me to make a new account. After the newly acquired account was created I started the KYC process to get the full experience, it got accepted almost instantly, but not even 30 seconds after acceptance the account was banned. I tried messaging my personal account manager (something you get if you are black level, in my experience totally useless, never responds). I created a support ticket expressing my frustration, they answered within a day or so and ”fixed” the issue. I can access the account, sure. But I can’t do ANYTHING, I can’t add money to my wallet, gets rejected for ”security reasons”. Support wants me to try another method, surprise surprise, nothing works. And when trying to talk to support, all they do is copy paste the message I recieve when attempting to add money, and then close the chat, and that’s after waiting one hour to speak to someone. I can’t even make a purchase using a prepaid voucher, so not only is AstroPay now completely useless, I have €2000 euros in vouchers that I might aswell use as campfire fuel.TLDR; used to be great, now AWFUL- customer support non-existent- vouchers no longer works, if it’s personal or for all europeans/swedes is unknown- information regarding ongoing issues doesnt existReply To AP: user ID 27dCFGcNvF

name: Valentino San
title: Astropay = Scammers
text: Avoid depositing your funds with Astropay. It seems they may be engaged in deceptive practices because they haven't released my funds yet. I've been receiving automated responses repeatedly, instructing me to wait. I strongly advise against depositing your money with them, as there's a high likelihood of losing it. Stay away from them!!Update: 06/10/2023Is this an automated response of yours? In my emails, I'm inquiring for information, but you've only stated that the relevant department is conducting an investigation without offering any indication of the expected timeline for completion. How long more do I have to wait?Furthermore, I can no longer send messages to the Astro chat agent through the app. I'm curious about the reason behind this. Is there an intention to block all communication to prevent me from checking on my funds' status? Anyway, I've supplied the requested information. I genuinely hope your intention is to help me with this issue and not solely to attempt to remove my review on Trustpilot.Update: 09/10/2023No response from Astropay.STAY AWAY FROM ASTROPAY!!Update: 13/10/2023I had no choice but to deposit to a merchant because I was not allowed to withdraw the funds at all!!Stay away from Astropay!!

title: I sent some money to my wife from the…
text: I sent some money to my wife from the app using send to a contact instead of to mobile money. She was forced to open an account to withdraw which she did but since some commission or transaction charges were deducted, the funds became insufficient to withdraw by around a dollar. To top up that amount in order to get the minimum amount to withdraw, she was required to top up with at least 10 USD. On doing so, the amount was deducted some commission or transaction charges again and has two accounts (dollar account and Ksh account) which makes two accounts with insufficient funds to withdraw. Why would the amount sent to top up so that someone can withdraw go to a dollar account while sent from Ksh without any prompt? On trying to convert the dollar account to Ksh account, the Ksh account doesn't show any amount but in the account balance you can see the funds.Customer care are also reluctant to assist.

title: Carson Lideshi
text: I am satisfied to see withdrawal section on my latest update, Astropay needs to pick up pace and beat the giants in financial field, you can do it guys.At first with the red logo the app's agenda wasn't clear, now it's much better and objective.Please improve on the following areas: make deposit and withdrawal instant and stable to majority of your consumers, introduce a crytocurrency account, do not hurry into becoming a crypo brokerage firm, instead partner with already established brokers and offer them avenue to deposit and withdrawal funds, introduce password protection when transferring money from one astropay user to another for security reasons. Change marketing strategies, restrict Facebook comments to avoid your clients being scammed, respond to complaints in time. In nutshell, I believe in astropay, I believe astropay is the future of virtual credit and debit cards, and I strongly believe with fast but steady improvement AstroPay will be the best there's.

name: Maria
title: Voraussetzung Nutzung Astropay
text: Für jeden den es interessiert, dass sind die Bedingungen um mit Astropay Guthaben zahlen zu können:Hello Maria,Hope you are well!We detail below the reasons why the document may be rejected:-Not be in PDF format.-Not having AstroPay account holder information.-Documents with password.-Document sent without being issued within 3 months of the date the document was sent to our system.-Bank statement without the history of the last 3 months.-Bank statement in the name of a third party.-Proof of payslip was sent and not the bank statement.-The document has to be in English.Please keep in mind the proof of funds must be greater than USD 15,000.We kindly ask you to upload the source of found in your application!Also, falls ihr kein monatliches Nettoeinkommen von 5.000€ habt. Nutzt definitiv einen Dienstleister der fähiger ist!Bereits gekauftes Guthaben wird nicht erstattet, sondern einbehalten. Wahrscheinlich wird damit der unfähige Kundenservice gezahlt 😇

I do not recommend using my account ID, which is yKzvOc52XD. I hope this reaches the competent department they have, and I hope that restrictions on the use of my balance will be lifted.And I have everything to prove that 100%My id / yKzvOc52XDI sent to you repeatedly. There is no point and there is no justification for restricting the funds. I sent more than 40 complaints. Nothing new. The fixed response. We will solve your case and we appreciate your understanding. About a month ago, the balance is present on the account, but it is restricted and cannot be used, sent, or benefited from. Using payments appears. The process could not be completed and an error occurred. Such errors made me lose my money, $700. They were seized by Astropay. name: Adrian Adi
title: Promising Yet Flawed: A Critical Look at AstroPay's Deposit and Security Issues
text: I am assigning a three-star rating to AstroPay due to a couple of significant issues that have affected my experience. The primary concern revolves around the card deposit option, which unfortunately displays the message "Payment method not available. This payment method is temporarily out of service." This inconsistency has hindered my ability to make deposits conveniently, leading to frustration and inconvenience during crucial transactions.Moreover, a second issue I've encountered is the absence of a standard bank transfer option. Instead, the platform directs users to a website named volt.io for bank transfers, prompting the user to input sensitive bank login information. This setup has raised significant security concerns for me, as I am hesitant to share such confidential information on an external website, especially one that I am unfamiliar with.I appreciate the functionality and potential that AstroPay offers, and I recognize that technical glitches can occur from time to time. However, the ongoing unavailability of card deposits and the security risks associated with the bank transfer redirection have negatively impacted my overall impression of the platform. In order to improve user experience and bolster trust, I strongly urge AstroPay to promptly address these issues and provide a safer, more seamless deposit process. Until then, my rating remains at three stars, reflecting my reservations about these critical aspects of the service.

name: David
title: Unjustified Ban!
text: I am writing this review to express my deep disappointment with Astropay, a company that I trusted with my hard-earned money and loyalty. Recently, I found myself banned from their platform without any valid reason or explanation, leaving me shocked and frustrated.I had 800€ in my account and when I try to access my account, I just see a random message saying that my account was blocked. I did not even receive an email or a notification about this. Also, over time, I had accumulated a substantial sum in Astropoints, which I never had the opportunity to exchange due to their sudden decision to ban me. I had diligently followed all their terms and conditions, and there was no indication of any policy violation on my part. Despite my attempts to seek clarification and resolution, Astropay has remained unresponsive, leaving me in utter disbelief and dismay.The lack of transparency and proper communication throughout this ordeal has been truly disappointing. As a customer, I deserve to be treated fairly and provided with an explanation for their actions. Astropay's failure to address this issue adequately reflects poorly on their commitment to customer satisfaction and trust.I demand an immediate reinstatement of my account and access to the funds I rightfully earned. This unjust ban has not only resulted in a significant loss for me but has also shattered my confidence in Astropay as a reliable financial institution.I strongly caution others against using Astropay's services, as their actions demonstrate a complete disregard for their customers' trust and loyalty. My experience with Astropay has been nothing short of disappointing!EDIT: They replied via email, stating that my account is under investigation for the next 30 days and that they are unable to provide any further information about it. Ridiculous!

name: Christian
title: If you want a serious and professional wallet provider, stay away from Astropay!
text: I made a bank transfer from Astropay of almost 1000EUR to my own account in another bank. It still hasn't arrived, and my receiving bank asked for transaction details to check. Neither the Web or Phone App from Astropay has the details for bank transfers. I didn't even get an email as a receipt when it was processed. I have now been waiting more than 5 days for a response from Astropay asking about the transaction details. Despite that they claim to have a response policy of up to 48 hours in their help center, I haven't heard anything. They also say in the help center that there should be possible to chat with an agent, according to what I can see this doesn't exist on the Web or in their App. Also no phone number available for support. Astropay have a long way to go before I will recommend them to anyone!

text: Hey. User IDZEDKdKKYGot an email about an offer on Casinodays.com about a 100% cashback worth 100NOK, for your deposit with Astropay during promotion period. Even in that section I had offers for free spins, but nothing mentioning Astropay, so I figured Casinodays auto-register it to Astropay, and I get credited.Deposited 100NOK, and have now checked for 2 hours and I have received no cashback from Astropay. I contacted Casinodays, but they could not help me they said. The support service insisted that this was something Astropay have to fix, and credit my account with cashback. I said i did everyhing according to the terms, but they would not help me, and urged me to contact Astropay customer support. So, can you credit me the cashback which you are offering on this site? My account is restricted and I can't even transfer it to my balance.I would have recieved your late response and the issue has not been resolved. This is what was sent."Hello Joel,Hope you are well!I checked on our system that your voucher has been bought via a reseller and it was issued in Euros.In this case you need to get in contact with the Reseller and check if they can issue it again in the currency used in your country or ask for a refund.You will not be able to deposit the voucher because it is not from your region. Also, reseller vouchers cannot be added to the wallet.Regards,"You guys are fully aware that you all are running a SCAM with people's money and your reseller recharge.com don't do refunds or exchanges. Please stop selling people vouchers that they can't use. I will be going on a marketing campaign to ensure users are not scammed by your company again since you all are a waste of time.

I'm sure that like me, you'll find it to be an excellent resource that you can rely on.

text: How I wish I could give Astropay -0 stars. This is the worst company I have ever seen. They let you create an account, verify it, transfer money, but your money is not usable anywhere. You cannot transfer it back to your bank account and support does not reply. Save yourself the stress and don't download their app nor register with them. You will regret it. I lost $20.Update: Due to this review, Astropay replied the email messages I sent on the 6th of February, 2023 on the 16th February, 2023. 10 days later with no useful information! Will keep updated.

name: Titus Ling
title: Made a withdrawal for 300 USD via…
text: Made a withdrawal for 300 USD via bitcoin, and what followed was an absolute nightmare. I had to exchange multiple emails over a never-ending 2-month period just to make them understand that the money wasn't sent. But they insisted it was! What a joke! They even had the audacity to send me a hash key that doesn't even have my wallet address in the recipients list. Seriously, do NOT even think about depositing your hard-earned money with these scam artists! They are nothing but a bunch of con artists trying to rob you blind!***Edit: Astropay gave me 20,000 coins that are completely useless and cannot even be withdrawn when I lost 300 USD. Instead of owning up to their mistake, they had the nerve to ask me to update my feedback, and I politely declined since they still hadn't returned my money. But guess what? They wouldn't stop bothering me with THREE messages, begging me to update this feedback. Well, here you go, I updated the feedback, and it's just as scathing as it should be.Update 2: Astropay is still relentlessly bothering me to change my feedback. I've had enough and blocked them for good. Stay away from this shady company!

name: Pikoo
title: Scam alert ! Beware
text: I can't believe that they have changed so much within the last few months. I work for a specific forex based company and our users have been using this payment gateway regularly. But in the last few days some of our clients were complaining that they have failed somehow to deposit the amount due to some gateway error. But the payment was deducted. At first I also thought that this might be some kind of temporary glitch and I myself started testing with an amount of 500 USD. I purchased a voucher. Then my voucher disappeared mysteriously and the other payment modes were not visible at that moment. I tried to contact the support team through email regarding the unavailability of the voucher in my account, but didn't get any response. So I somehow managed to get their WhatsApp contact number +44 7497 452134 and tried to talk with them. I can show the proof of our conversations and then you will know what game they are playing with the customers. They told me to deposit 500 USD again to complete the pending transaction in order to get that 1000 USD reflected in my account. So I fell into their trap once again and made the deposit. In the mean time I also took note of some of their suspicious activities. They transferred internally the amount to some sub accounts. I also have the proof of that. Then after funding the wallet they quickly transferred the amount to one of their sub accounts this time also and told me that "the finance team are requesting a deposit of 500 USD to get 1500USD". So now you can understand that how they are trying to scam the customers by these kind of fraudulent activities. I tried to give them warning but they were so arrogant. The didn't listen to me or care about refunding the 1000USD that was deposited. And now I am planning to file a complain at the consumers forum court. So guys be careful and don't try to fall under the charm of their swindling acts. Don't trust them anymore.To Astropay - PLEASE DON'T GIVE THESE FAKE REPLIES TO ME AND OTHER CUSTOMERS.

We tried to integrate with them for half year, but due to dozens of errors in the integration, information flow we resigned of cooperation with them. During these 6 months, our account manager was changed 3 times, because old ones were resigning. They were improperly converting currencies, due to that, till now 3 of our customers can't get their refund, and we never received their money. When we are contacting their support, you receive answers like "I'm out of office, I'll ask next week" - this isn't anywhere being serious financial company.

name: Katarina Sykorova
title: STAY AWAY!! FRAUD!
text: STAY AWAY!!! Read carefully guys! what they do is definitely illegal. I registered, got verified and deposited to Astropay account. Then I transferred money to "card" and Im stuck. As I read here Im not the only one they let register and deposit money even though in my country astrocard is absolutely useless. Also useless in all surrounding countries and in whole Europe!!!!! (except Spain, UK Portugal - too far to travel) WHY do they let you register?? It is NOT OK!! I cannot pay anywhere with it, I get country restriction block every time. And their "live" bot told me I cannot withdraw ... nope my dear (oh, and after telling me it would connect live agent it just ends the chat and :D YES!! it asks for rating!!). VERY bad joke. I read all reviews here and also their responses. Yes they do respond to 97% of negative reviews which should be good news BUT they reply exact same crap every time! "sorry for inconvenience ... we could not find your contact email ... and my favorite response: "you cannot withdraw but you can use our card in many stores all around you" ... you KNOW very well that Im unable to pay with it and that is why this is illegal!Well, YOU GUYS from Astropay, if you really read these reviews, you dont have to look for my emails - I did not bother with sending emails and waiting for your response after I was told I cannot withdraw my own money that you basically fraudulently took from me. I did try that "live" joke in your app few times, you will surely find those "chats".You should actually be able to give me list of all merchants that accept Astropay in Slovakia - they are your business partners, correct?? So name some! So I can actually use my money.I will wait one day for a reaction from you here (or to my email, doesn’t matter) and in case you will return my money back to my credit card in reasonable time I will be more than happy to apologise in huge bold letters for everyone to see. Otherwise I will take this every place possible until I get my money back. Normally Im extremely easy, nice and understanding and patient person but I had this with paysafecard and lost money forever and I will not let this just go till i get my money back.

title: Only money in, no money out. Customer care is a bot... not a nice one
text: I bought a 400 pounds astropay card believing i could use it to fund a broker account in the US. When I found out that cards issued overseas were not accepted, I attempted to obtain a refund of the said 400 pounds. No human customer care, bots instructing me that as the money in the card was a transfer from my bank account and not received from other merchants, i would not be allowed a refund. I emailed customer care, twice, no answer. Easy way to make money astropay! you let people put money in and you don't let them take it out... why didn't I think of something like this before? genius!Update , here is the answer I received :Thank you for the contact!Please note that the card purchased it will be only allowed to use in the same region where it was bought, so it seems that you are trying to use the card out of the region allowed, so in this case we invite you to use it in any of our many partner sites located in your current location.No answer to my request to refund (at 72h) as their card is not fit for purpose. I shall take it up with my bank.

In order to obtain more information related to our loyalty program, please contact the responsible team at #emailremoved The loyalty team used to reply in 5 days 7 days sometime 10 days but they just reject the documents without any explanation just writing unable to match the criteria and thirdly not a single response from the compliance team. Now the new thing is whenever we type #emailremoved when we click on new email the name of the email is shown as a FRAUD. name: e.a
title: 100EUR lost
text: For weeks ago I bought one Astropay card from dundle.com (from Sweden) and tried to use at several casinos but I could not use it. I got an error message every time that said "your deposit cannot be processed on this sit. Your payment region is not valid, for more information, please contact support”. I contacted dundle.com and they could not help me and referred me to Astropay, which I did. The answer from Astropay was:”the card purchased will be only allowed to use in the same region where it was bought, so it seems that you are trying to use the card out of the region allowed, In this case we invite you to use it in any of our many partner sites located in your current location” - no sites in Sweden allows me to use Astropay???And the second answer was:”As verified, the card was not purchased in our platform: it was purchased from a reseller. Therefore, it is not possible for our finance department to refund it. We recommend contacting the reseller directly to verify the possibility of a refund”. I have now tried to contact Astropay again without any response. Everything is a roundabout and no one takes responsibility. I do not know how to get my money back as no sites in Sweden accepts the payment method. I’ve tried to find but it’s not possible. And I cant whitdrawal the money from the app.It should NOT be legal for you to sell astropay on dundle.com in Sweden when it is not even possible to use!! Give me my money back.

name: Anne K
title: STAY AWAY
text: Ref ticket ID 376933I you want to buy AstroPay Card, by all means don’t do that via their own app or website. I bought 2 AstroPay Cards 60 hours ago with instant payment by Trustly.The payment was deducted from my account instantly as they should with Trustly, and the payment /issued credit was instantly sent to you by Trustly - like it always is, but I still have 2 AstroPay cards that’s not yet activated. You say in the app that the payment approval should take approximately 2 days from payment - which is wrong - when you all ways get this approval instant from Trustly. The main consept with Trustly, and why they are attractive both for merchants and consumers, is that it’s instant.They have a poor Customer service with only mail contact, no customer service during weekends, so if you need help Friday night, you can earliest expect a reply Tuesday or Wednesday next week. 🤯 I have actually experienced just the same when making my first orders after installing the app a long time ago, but irritating enough I forgot.Holding on to payments without issuing the product the customer has paid for is of course smart if you think of bank interest. One or two transactions for a few days is a small thing in itself, but when doing this with all transactions it’s not small anymore. And I know that this isn’t what Trustly expects of their merchants.I’ll of course update the review when I get a reply.

Please when u are using their service please remember that if ur transaction was successful then not a problem, but definitely ur transaction may fail 1/10 times and that 1 time they wont respond. Should you have any other questions, please contact us again. Kind regards, ..... NETELLER Team."It seems like the support at AstroPay is not available on email and there seems like there is no way to contact AstroPay by phone. I would hesitate to use AstroPay to buy cards with big amounts.- Note 1 to your answer : Thank you. I will not put my private email address out in public. name: Xiao Liaw
title: SCAM ! DO NOT USE !
text: Hello everyone, I literally created an account here just to write this message for everybody to take caution of this site called AstroPay (which I doubt anyone will actually use it except me, the dumbass). So basically I would like to deposit to Pinnacle, and the payment method available in my country is only AstroPay, ecoPayz and Bitcoin. I was pretty curious to check out AstroPay because I was thinking, well if a big book like Pinnacle accepts it, nothing can goes wrong right? And that is where I am wrong!I registered at AstroPay and trying to make a deposit of 100$ in which I will deposit later to Pinnacle, and the only option available is through bitcoin at that moment, so I purchased some bitcoin at remitano and proceed to transfer the amount required to buy the so-called "AstroPay card", at first I wasn't worried because I know sometimes bitcoin transaction takes awhile so I waited... 1 hour.... 3 hours.... and now 24 hours have passed. I tried to lookup their customer service and surprisingly a "big" company like AstroPay doesn't even have a livechat or call! Only email! Very funny. So I've decided to email them trying to describe my problems and asking why is it taking so long.Now here's the part where it pissed me off the most, as a payment option company they asked me to send a payment proof of my transaction, like seriously can't you just check it through your side? But is okay I will cooperate so I've sent all the details required, the blockchain link, the proof that I've sent the exact BTC to the address mentioned by AstroPay. After that, every reply I get from the customer service is just a COPY-PASTE message that they require a NEW PAYMENT PROOF! They don't even bother to TRY to fix your problem, they literally just doesnt care about your transaction, moreover it's a bitcoin transaction so I am pretty sure I am getting scammed here without a doubt... Since there's no way I can chargeback or anything.After this incident I've done some Google search and I realized there are alot of bad reviews regarding AstroPay already but I am too late to realize it, so please help me to make this post go viral and get enough attention to be a the Google search top result so whenever people search "Astropay scam" at google this will be at the top! Also, if AstroPay is reading this, and you would like to ACTUALLY HELP ME to resolve my case feel free to comment here too and I WILL REMOVE THIS THREAD, but until my 100$ is credited or refunded, this will stay forever.For those big sportsbook like Pinnacle or bet365, PLEASE STOP ACCEPTING PAYMENT FROM ASTROPAY ALREADY, because it's a STUPID company and there might be people like me to use it for betting and end up getting scammed. And for those who is curious about AstroPay and you are already reading until here, please just change your mind and look for something else, because this AstroPay doesn't even let you WITHDRAW, so even if you're winning 10 grand at a betting site, your money will also forever stuck at AstroPay, there is no way out so it is very useless platform.I've made the worst decision of my life, now don't make yours. Thank you for reading! Please if possible comment anything down below and make this post go viral until it gets the attention of AstroPay, then maybe I can get 100$ back (even thou the hope is low)

name: James Pak
title: TOTAL SCAM
text: TOTAL SCAM - stay very far away. Welcome bonus and requirements very misleading, terms say 40x but what they don't tell you until you deposit is that it's actually 35x of not just your deposit total but your total bankroll. My $300 deposit matched w a $300 bonus had a wagering requirement of $20000. That's actually bonus amount x 70. Deceitful, unfair, and ridiculous. The gaming license they advertise from curaçao is also fake. Any egaming platform that is licensed by curaçao should have a link on the bottom of the page where you can check the validity of the license. Blockbets doesn't have one, i also went to curaçao gaming board website and did a manual check - the license listed doesn't exist. The discord channel they have also has a bunch of fake members - giving the impression to unsuspecting players that they are legit. I read terms and conditions numerous times - followed every rule. Once i completed my bonus requirements my withdraw attempt was pending for 24 hours - then all winnings were confiscated minus my original deposit. No agents were available to discuss once this happened. At this point - w $3400 winnings of confiscated, i was actually shocked they even allowed me to withdraw my intitial deposit. Safe to assume the presale they have for their own token $BBETS is also a scam.

name: Daniel
title: Avoid - don't send withdrawals as claimed
text: Really disappointing experience with Wazbee. Opened an account and deposited, turned over quite a bit of money, tried to request a withdrawal (made around $200), withdrawal was approved and even showed up on their live stream of withdrawals, claiming it was sent in 4 minutes.However, there was never any withdrawal sent - My crypto wallet isn't showing any pending transactions when I search on the blockchain explorer.I asked live chat to provide me the transaction ID of the withdrawal, which they couldn't do - they couldn't even confirm if the withdrawal had been sent or not, promising someone would get back to me by email (which no one did of course).Really disappointing to see the website blatantly lying to customers regarding their withdrawal processing times and whether they have actually processed withdrawals when they claim.Further they have a very strict and vague turnover requirement before you can withdraw - far higher than any other casino I've seen. It's more than the 3x claimed here on the casino guru website - it actually varies from 6x to 15x depending what game you play.Of course the website claims this is an 'anti-fraud' protection but we all know it's so no one can make a withdrawal.Stay away. Dodgy website. Don't deposit, you won't be able to withdraw and worse, you will be lied to and have information withheld.

name: Taina
title: STAY AWAY! x3 WAGER ON EACH DEPOSIT & I'VE SPENT OVER AN HOUR TRYING TO VERIFY MY ACCOUNT!
text: THEY HAVE A x3 WAGER ON EACH OF YOUR DEPOSIT! You simply cannot deposit let's say 50 euros and withdraw it afterwards until you've made bets for 150 euros. UNBELIEVEBLE! They have a term that states "5.12 In cases where a player requests a withdraw without meeting the minimum turnover requirements, WazBee reserves the right to charge a 15% fee on the requested withdraw amount". Even though I told the support that I would like to request a withdraw with that 15% fee the support told me "You have to meet the wagering requirements of x3". SWAY AWAY FROM THIS WEBISTE! THEY SCAM FOLKS!From my experience the RTP isn't the greatest and it eats your money pretty fast.Their verification rules are stupid. Nowhere in their terms is written that they do not accept Revolut bank statements. Also when I had to verify my credit card the back side was declined just because I have to cover the CVV/CVC code with a piece of paper and not with a program such as paint etc. They don't ask for a selfie but rather you have to use your camera and scan your face ( haven't done that before, I don't see it as a problem but more as extra steps that are useless, because they can ask you for a photo of you. )Not a big variety of game providers. ( And from the providers that they already have a lot of games are missing. )They have a live chat support that wasn't very helpful. On some questions that I've asked their response was "You can try to do it and see if it works". And we call that 'support'.The website design looks good but the images that they're using for the games are not the right size. Some of them look weird, stretch like someone was in a hurry to download/upload everything that had to be uploaded and it didn't matter if it looked good or not.The EGTDigital provider doesn't work. The support told me to clean the cookies, try with a different browser or restart my PC and non of them worked. I didn't bother to ask them again because they weren't going to help me out.My personal opinion is to stay away from this casino and find something that was founded before 2024 and has a good reputation among gamblers.P.S: The fact that they make you wager your own money x3 without a applied bonus is NOT right! They should shut them down! STAY AWAY or Gamble on your own risk.
